My wife was at high risk to develop a dangerous syndrome when she was undergoing treatment for ivf.  She was at high risk because of something in her medical history, which the doctor knew, and yet the doctor never discussed the possibility of developing the syndrome with us at any real length.  No changes were made in her treatment regimen to help prevent developing this syndrome (which could have been done).  Unfortunately, after egg retrieval she started to feel sick and we called the clinic.  The first day, the doctor told us to ignore what she was feeling and that is was normal.  The doctor didn't follow-up in any way after that.  On the third day, my wife was very sick and she called and talked to a nurse, telling her how badly she felt, and the nurse said the doctor would call her back.  She didn't get a call back, so she e-mailed the online chart the doctor could see, and still got no response.  She then called a couple more times, and the receptionist kept putting her through to nurses voice mails. The people at this clinic want to take no responsibility for patient care.  If you call them, you can expect to wait the entire day for them to call you back (even in the case of an emergency). They clearly do not care even the least bit about you or maybe they would check up to see how you are doing after an emergency which they supposedly knew about.

Beyond that, they have everything integrated - with COVID testing, a lab for blood work, vaccines, flu shots, etc. right in the office, and they have women's health experts as well.
